alert.note: Alert for CAZ034; CAZ035 (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued April 04 at 8:15PM PDT until April 06 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TUESDAY TO 8 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 13 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast. * WHEN...From 11 AM Tuesday to 8 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor beach erosion is possible around the time of high tide.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
